dt: {bc}the leaf of an herb or a grass
{bc}the flat expanded part of a leaf as distinguished from the petiole
{bc}something resembling the blade of a leaf: such as
{bc}the broad flattened part of an oar or paddle
{bc}an arm of a screw propeller, electric fan, or steam turbine
{bc}the broad flat or concave part of a machine (such as a bulldozer or snowplow) that comes into contact with the material to be moved
used chiefly in naming cuts of meat
{bc}the flat portion of the tongue immediately behind the tip

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}blæd{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}blat{/it} leaf, Latin {it}folium{/it}, Greek {it}phyllon{/it}, Old English {it}blōwan{/it} to blossom {ma}{mat|blow|}{/ma}
shortdef: leaf; especially : the leaf of an herb or a grass
the flat expanded part of a leaf as distinguished from the petiole
something resembling the blade of a leaf: such as

dt: {bc}to hit (a ball or shot) with the leading edge of the clubface {bc}{sx|skull||}

dt.t: I hit a wedge from 45 yards and basically {wi}bladed{/wi} it over the green.
Connect a pair of these wild things to your feet and you are {wi}blading{/wi}—cruising with all the cool of ice skating but without the ice.

shortdef: to hit (a ball or shot) with the leading edge of the clubface : skull

dt: {bc}a computer {d_link|server|server} designed to be used as a modular part of a larger assembly

dt.t: To minimize lag, CCP started using hundreds of {wi}blade servers{/wi}—thin computers that sit vertically on special racks, like books on a shelf—and solid-state drives, which are much faster than the traditional spinning hard-disk drives.

shortdef: a computer server designed to be used as a modular part of a larger assembly

dt: {bc}either of a pair of large, flat, triangular-shaped bones that lie above the rib cage on either side of the upper back {bc}{sx|scapula||}

dt.t: He has a wing-shaped tribal tattoo between his {wi}shoulder blades{/wi}.
… types who didn't wash and grew hair to their {wi}shoulder blades{/wi}.

shortdef: either of a pair of large, flat, triangular-shaped bones that lie above the rib cage on either side of the upper back : scapula

dt: {bc}a small, thin, sharp piece of metal that is used in a razor

shortdef: a small, thin, sharp piece of metal that is used in a razor

dt: {bc}either of a pair of large triangular bones lying one in each dorsal lateral part of the thorax, being the principal bone of the corresponding half of the shoulder girdle, and articulating with the corresponding clavicle or coracoid

et: New Latin, from Latin, shoulder blade, shoulder
shortdef: either of a pair of large triangular bones lying one in each dorsal lateral part of the thorax, being the principal bone of the corresponding half of the shoulder girdle, and articulating with the corresponding clavicle or coracoid —called also shoulder blade
